name: Billiards
description: Billiards was my A-Level Computer Science project. I was also studying Further Maths at the time, where Elastic Collisions in Two Dimensions was a topic that I wanted to get a head start on, so I chose to adopt it into my programming project. It was my first time using C++, and I had to find a suitable graphics / mouse-input library and implement rotation matrix logic in code.

name: DSAVisualiser
description: At the end of my second semester at university, I was already looking ahead to the modules that I would be studying the following year. One of which was Data Structures and Algorithms - an extremely important topic for problem solving and interviews. I decided to make an interactive visualisation tool to help others on my course. I have since created a YouTube series on Data Structures and Algorithms which uses the application.

name: Peitho
description: This was the coursework for my Web App Development module at Oxford Brookes. We were tasked with creating a debate forum with complex post interactions: Claims (the main type of post) should be organised into Topics; Claims can optionally be related to other Claims as Equivalent or Opposed; Replies can be made to Claims or other Replies with the relation Rebuttal, Clarification, or Supporting Argument. We were required to use Flask and SQLite on the Backend - we were given a database schema and setup script, but I was able to modify them slightly to better fit my application.
technologies: HTML, SCSS, TypeScript, Python, Flask, SQLite

name: Intro to Programming
description: In the first semester of my university course, I spoke to a lot of people that had no prior Computer Science experience and were struggling with the Problem Solving and Programming module. I offered help where I could, but after seeing some of the same questions from multiple people, I decided to make a Programming tutorial series. I decided to focus on the core concepts, with minimal fancy language-specific tips and tricks. I also showed off small amounts of C++ and Java code for comparison, to make learning a new language later easier.

name: Intro to OOP
description: In the second semester of my university course, I spoke to a lot of people that were struggling with the concepts from the Object Oriented Programming module. Specifically, I think that Classes and Objects are very hard to describe in a short sentence without an example. I wanted to create a follow-up to my Intro to Programming series to explain each of the core concepts. I also included a crash-course-style video on applying the concepts from the previous series to the Java language.

name: WebPortfolio2023
description: This is site you are current looking at! It's the second iteration of my portfolio site. For this version, I wanted to use a UI framework. I decided on React because 1. it seems suitable for the scale of this project, 2. I have limited-time access to a web development crash course, and I wanted to learn and apply the React material, 3. React is popular...

name: Basic Strategy Trainer
description: This is an interactive endless quiz for practicing Casino Blackjack Basic Strategy. Mathematicians have analysed Casino Blackjack games and found the optimal moves to make given every possible hand. Players can memorise the hands to win more games. (Note: Basic Strategy does not give you enough of an advantage to win more games than you use; I do not advocate careless gambling, please do not gamble more than you can afford to lose).

name: Polyglot Quiz
description: This is a very simple quiz program that explores the syntactic differences between a number of programming languages. I do not claim to be an expert in all of the following languages, but I had a lot of fun working with them.
technologies: Python, Java, JavaScript, C, C++, C#, Rust, Go, Swift, Dart, and many more

name: Matryoshka TicTacToe
description: Prior to attending the Serious Game Design course at Hochschule Luzern, Switzerland, I was tasked with designing an improvement to Tic Tac Toe. My idea was to give players tokens of different weights, such that you can place a counter over the top of your opponent's smaller counters. This project is a demo that I used to test my idea with friends and family.

name: Bold First Half
description: This is a very simple web project built in a few hours that converts text into a format that some find to be easier to read. Most words can be read from just the first few letters, so by emphasising the first half of every word, it can allow your brain to skip non-essential letters and read quicker.

name: WebPortfolio (2022)
description: This was my first Portfolio Site, and was my first web project outside of a tutorial. Given the context, I am very happy with the site, but it is now very outdated given my experience with web development.
